attributes.action: ALL towns to be perfectly encased by a ring road to define their boundaries
attributes.background: Every town in the UK should have a ring road built around the town boundary to properly define the town limits of construction. Construction of any building outside of this ring road should be made illegal, expect if it is unable to be built in the town eg. a farm building.
attributes.additional_details: The UK government should directly fund and plan the construction of these vitally important ring roads, with a waiver of all planning laws and objections from parish councils.

attributes.action: Exempt NHS from immigration charges
attributes.background: As UK goverment is putting a charge on overseas recruitment, this would burden our NHS. Already we face a unfilled gap. These charges would further widen the gap in our health services.
attributes.additional_details: Immigration charges from April 2017

attributes.action: Setup a financial scheme for supermarkets to donate food they are throwing away.
attributes.background:
Supermarkets and food chains. Could have a scheme were they donate food that they are throwing away to charitys food banks and hostels. 
If the government could make it part of the funds they use for these places. Supermarkets could get payed a little on some kind of charity scheme in return

attributes.action: Uk Goverment to fund Age Uk so no elderly person has to be alone.
attributes.background: Age Uk provide services and support at a national and local level to inspire, enable and support older people.  Age Uk are based purely on donations , fundraising , legacies , gifts and voluntary contributions.
attributes.additional_details: Uk goverment to fund Age Uk so no elderly person has to be alone , without the volunteers at age Uk millions of elderly would go without company and health advice. Goverment funding could create jobs getting carers to go to an elderly persons house even if its just to have a conversation or help with any task they need doing. Taking care of our elderly is extremely important , everyone matters.

attributes.action: Amend the criteria to be certified sight impaired or severely sight impaired
attributes.background: The current criteria is shown below and does not appear to make sense
attributes.additional_details: Your ophthalmologist will carry out these tests on both of your eyes. If you have lost the sight in one of your eyes, your ophthalmologist will not be able to certify you as sight impaired or severely sight impaired unless you have significant sight loss in your other eye. This is because your other eye will largely compensate for the loss of sight in the affected eye.

attributes.action: Remove compulsory lessons from school curriculum for GCSE students
attributes.background: Students are too often forced into subjects they are not interested in or have absolutely no use for. It would be better for teachers, students, and schools alike if no subjects were mandatory at GCSE level and students had the option to choose exactly which subjects they'd like to study in school.

attributes.action: Remove Section 10 of the Swedish Derogation used by some Recruitment Agencies.
attributes.background: The Swedish Derogation is being used by Agencies allowing them to have Government exemption from Regulation 5 of the Agency Workers Regulation of 2011. Regulation 5 makes it law for Agencies to pay their workers the same basic pay as permanent staff of a similar grade after 12 weeks of employment.
attributes.additional_details: The Swedish derogation is unfair to British and other EU based agencies that have no such deal.  There should be fairness in the marketplace for employers and workers alike, and the Swedish Derogation is not fair to British workers or other non-Swedish Agencies who don't have an agreement like this.  Also, the likelihood of benefiting from the Derogation is non-existent if the Agency keeps you in the same place of employment as most factory based agencies tend to do.

attributes.action: ALTERNATIVE BUDGET: Minimum Corporate Income Tax based on Revenue
attributes.background: Government bears the responsibility and risk of economic stability and all companies participating in the economy should be treated equally and the minimum corporate income tax on revenue should be the cost.
attributes.additional_details:
FTSE 100 companies, on average, have seen the corporate tax expense to revenue go from 4% to 1% over the last 5 years.

All companies regardless of size should pay a minimum corporate income tax of 1% on their reported revenue for UK companies and on revenue generated from sales from the UK for non-UK companies.   
Advanced minimum corporate tax would be collected at the point of sales and annual assessment will follow the existing tax system.

Read more at www.the-empty-chair.com/docs/MCIT.pdf

attributes.action: Scrap HS2 for a new Concorde program
attributes.background: Exchange the waste of money that is HS2 and restore national pride with a new Concorde

attributes.action: Start an investigation into assessments completed by ATOS
attributes.background: ATOS is the company currently funded by the government to assess claimants for disability benefits. There have been many horror stories of "nurses" not having the correct training or outright insulting the disabled or mentally ill. This is outrageous and we as the people should not stand for it.

attributes.action: Limiting maximum stake to £10 per spin on roulette machines in betting shops
attributes.background: Fixed odds betting terminal (fobts) have been in betting shops since the early 90s. They have a maximum stake of £100 but spin every 20 seconds. I personally have been working in the industry for years and have seen the destructive impact on families these machines cause.
attributes.additional_details: An average betting shop stake on horse racing is £10 so the stake on the fobts should be in line with all other betting mediums.

attributes.action: Adjust the new tougher law for using your phone or device in a car
attributes.background: The recent changes to the law on using phones or devices by the driver of a car, mean that when completely parked in a car park or paying using your device at a drive-thru, it has been confirmed by Greater Manchester Police that this is illegal if your engine is running.
attributes.additional_details:
The new tougher stance on the law is generally a good thing and should be even tougher for those that text or hold their device to call whilst driving. 

However it has been extended to include areas, as already mentioned, that border on the absurd.

Imagine a cold frosty morning, you scrape the windows and start the car. Whilst waiting for the windows to clear inside you use your phone, still parked on your drive or the outside your house. I now believe this to be illegal. 

A step too far?

attributes.action: To have the option to voluntarily money to the NHS budget before tax
attributes.background: It would be good if voluntarily you could opt into a tax add on where you pay your normal income tax and then voluntarily opt into paying 1%, 2%, 3% or 4% more on your income tax. The percentage you choose only goes to saving the NHS and there budget.

attributes.action: Introduce a ‘Brexit Tax’ to compensate the 48% who voted to remain in the EU
attributes.background: Almost everyone who voted in the EU referendum did so in the full knowledge that there will be a huge impact. Parliament should debate the introduction of a ‘Brexit Tax’ to compensate the 48% of voters who believe that the cost of leaving the EU is simply not worth it.
attributes.additional_details: The 'Brexit Tax' should be paid by the 52% who voted leave to compensate the people who voted for the UK to remain in the EU.

attributes.action: Add Portuguese history to the history curriculum at A-Level.
attributes.background: The UK's longest standing alliance (and the longest standing in the world)  is with Portugal - the Anglo-Portuguese Alliance, signed in 1386. Due to this, I believe that we should be taught about Portuguese History at A-Level to learn more about our oldest allies and their diverse history.
attributes.additional_details:
Why would this be beneficial?
Portugal first became a recognized Kingdom in 1139 under the rule of Dom Afonso I, and since has undergone various periods of significance, including a temporary Spanish rule, transition into a Republic and decolonization. It has a rich history which is very useful and interesting, from a historical point of view, so would give students a vivid insight into the history of our longest allies.

attributes.action: Remove 2+ lane from M606 joining M62 (Eastbound), West Yorks during peak hours
attributes.background: As a single driver not in a position to car share, I have to approach Chain Bar roundabout to access the M62 eastbound, direct access being a 2+ lane only. This adds time to a journey, often backs up traffic on the sliproad to the M606 and only increases traffic on the already busy roundabout.
attributes.additional_details:
The 2+ lane is free flowing while traffic builds on the roundabout and it cannot be beneficial to the environment having large amounts of vehicles on the road for up 15 minutes longer than necessary.
During recent roadworks the 2+ lane was temporarily removed and didn't create any problems. During peak travelling hours Monday to Friday (morning and evening), the 2+ lane should be removed.

attributes.action: Un-ban the use and purchase of Borax (not borax substitute) in the UK
attributes.background: Us Blacksmiths usually use Borax to De-oxidise hot metal mainly during forge welding. during this process too much O2 can cause a bad weld. if we can all buy Borax easily, this will cut out a large percentage of cost for forge-welding using Borax.
attributes.additional_details: It can also be used as a great detergent or as washing powder.

attributes.action: Decrease the unauthorised absence fine to £30 per parent.
attributes.background: £60 per parent is unaffordable for many parents, and reducing it to £30 will help many households to continue their daily lifestyles.

attributes.action: Remove the 5% surcharge on Direct Debit Vehicle Excise Duty (VED) payments.
attributes.background: It's possible to pay for vehicle tax (VED) via Direct Debit monthly, 6-monthly, or yearly. The monthly and 6-monthly options induce a 5% surcharge. Any surcharge should fairly reflect the administrative costs, but in this case the administrative costs should be very similar between the options.
attributes.additional_details:
The administrative costs should be relatively consistent between the monthly, 6-monthly and yearly options. In fact, administrative costs may be lower for the monthly option as there will be less requirement for part-refunds when people sell their vehicles.
The surcharge should reflect fair administrative costs and, as it currently stands, it doesn't seem to. The current structure feels like a throwback from the old paper based system.

attributes.action: Ban betting companies from sponsoring football teams.
attributes.background: Sutton Utd's Wayne Shaw was forced to resign after eating a pie during their FA Cup tie on Monday. Right from the start, the club had 'ruined' what could have been a magical night for them by choosing to accept S*nBets as a sponsor. Promoting gambling in this way should be banned.

attributes.action: Reimburse university fees for new graduates willing to teach for three years.
attributes.background: There is a dire shortage of teachers in the UK and the situation is getting worse. If the government were to reimburse university fees for new graduates willing to commit to a minimum of three years in a teaching role, then, this would create a massive incentive to join the profession.

attributes.action: A full public inquiry into Camelot's security procedures.
attributes.background: The Lottery operator Camelot in 2009 paid out a £2.5 million jackpot on a suspicious ticket and was fined £3 million by the Gambling Commission after an investigation.

attributes.action: Give Schools more funding to improve technology and buy new computers.
attributes.background: Schools need more funding to improve their technology as most of their equipment is up to 10 years old and needs tonne upgraded with newer technology / computers to help inprove children's learning.

attributes.action: Have a general election in 2018
attributes.background: The current government is not an elected government as it has completely changed since 2015. Therefore it is making decisions outside of the democratic system. Give the people a voice to decide whether this is the government they want to take them forward.

attributes.action: University Fees paid by Employers’ Graduate Tax – ‘Graduate Bond’ model
attributes.background: This petition proposes free university tuition fees for all students and calls for the universities and employers to bear their fair share of the risks and not just receive the rewards and help to avoid a sub-prime moral hazard student loan debt crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
No university tuition fees for students.
University tuition fees based on projected salary but capped at average actual salary for first 10 years of graduate’s working life.
Employer pays 12% Graduate Tax over 10 years to cover tuition fees plus interest and in return receive corporation tax credit.
Employers’ Graduate Tax expires 15 years after graduation.
Any shortfall will be the University’s risk and gains shared 50/50 between the university and employer.
Read more at the-empty-chair(dot)com

attributes.action: Make primary education optional and let children enjoy their childhood
attributes.background: The human brain is perhaps the most amazing thing ever created. It was designed for fast-paced reaction, cunning development, and sociable interaction, not to be sat in a classroom and given every known fact. The thrill is in seeking the truth for oneself; to experience every aspect of our universe!
attributes.additional_details: Why do we live? There is no fundamental law saying that we must all keep on going, but we do because we want to! Thus, should we live as we do not want? For the true meaning of life is not to learn of the men of old, but to do what one wishes and see this world truly, not through the eyes of "greater" men. Therefore, do not waste the very pinnacle of life with whiteboards and desks and pens, but allow our children to discover the world for themselves and come to love it, and not make them stress, toil and anger over copious works of other people. By this they will be more creative, making their own view, and will lead to a more advanced, happier and better society.

attributes.action: Significantly reduce administration fees for British Nationals living abroad
attributes.background:
Obtaining necessary documents like passports, birth certificates or registering births etc seems to be incredibly, and unjustifiably, expensive for overseas nationals. 

British nationals living overseas should not be penalised in such a way.
attributes.additional_details:
To register the birth of my son, who was born in Japan, will cost £150 to register with a further fee of £50 to obtain a copy of certificate which seems to be to be unjustifiably expensive. Passports, too, also levy a similarly heavy cost with a simple renewal costing more than £100.

These fees should be reduced and brought in-line with admin fees charged at home.

attributes.action: free prescriptions to people between 60 and 65 yrs old is wrong
attributes.background: concern for the funding of the NHS

attributes.action: Make it illegal to wear a helmet over 10 years old
attributes.background:
experts within the helmet industry such as Arai, and Shoei. have said that you should change your helmet every 5-7 years.
this is due to the degrading of the polystrene within the helmet, That is the most crucial bit as thats the part that saves you life!

attributes.action: Introduce transparency in property conveycing related charges
attributes.background: When you buy/sell/remortgage a property, the conveyncing solicitors gives you a quote to start with but the final bill is usually twice the quote (specially when buying). You dont even understand the charges they mention in the bill, nor you get a choice at that point and it feels like extortion.
attributes.additional_details: Solicitors fees are usually fixed but other hidden charges increases the finaly bill to twice or even more sometimes. For eg. 1) 'Ground Landlord notice fee' £100! Just to notify the council (land owner) that there is a change in owner. Telegraphic transfer fee £45 (you pay this twice if 2 transfers are to be made). There should transparency in these costs and some standardisation where possible.

attributes.action: Stop the eyesight test for the driving practical test.
attributes.background: For anyone going to be doing their driving test or is doing it, I think the eyesight test should not be in place. As long as we can see clearly that's all that matters, I don't see the point in having to read a number plate at a distance. Sign this petition help get the eyesight test removed
attributes.additional_details:
Well for those who fail and keep failing their driving test. if we fail so many times then get a refund. I have failed a few times and still booking for more.

Would be fair if we are able to get a refund for the driving test booking fee if we fail 3 times.

attributes.action: Stop university grants to be given based on household income in The UK.
attributes.background: As many people my age from 18-21, it's ridiculous that the government expect for a household income to have a link between my financial status and a household income, and a greater majority will have no financial help from these 'dependant people'.
attributes.additional_details: I believe this needs to be re-looked at and this is not not blindlessly asking for more money for everyone but letting those who need help and work hard for themselves with no financial help not struggle!

attributes.action: Bring back 05 armed forces pensions. New employment model for new recruits only
attributes.background: Armed forces pensions should not be altered from what people sign up for. Getting half way through your career and then to have the contract essentially ripped up is unacceptable.
attributes.additional_details: People join the armed forces for what is available at the time that includes the benefits and obviously the pension. This enabled people to start a fresh career after 22 years of service with a pension to help the transition. The contract should simply not be thrown out especially as members serving have no say in the matter. The new employment model is a betrayal on our armed forces just abandoning them after 22 years to go and start again at something completely different in life without support untill normal retirement age.

attributes.action: Exempt charge of £30(min)for letter to Unis from GPs re health of applicants.
attributes.background: Daughter has applied to Universities who requested letter from GP regarding her health. Local surgery have insisted on a payment of £30 claiming this is a NON-NHS service (apparently charges £30-55). How come a 'sick note' non chargeable to adults but students need to pay for a simple letter?
attributes.additional_details: The GP surgery required a payment of £30.  When questioned the Assistant Practice Manager advised that payment was in line with Government guidelines of £30- 55.  Personally think this is outrageous given students now required to pay for education and this is another hidden cost to any student wanting to go to Uni (costs of which are prohibitive to most).

attributes.action: refunds should be given for bets placed on non starters
attributes.background: many punters are losing out in singles doubles trebles fc/tc. placepots etc. I and the majority if not all punters would like a refund if a horse refuses to start the race. It is wrong at the highest level. we don't want a free bet where you don't get your stake back. we just want refunded.
attributes.additional_details: 3.10 Newcastle 23 January 2017 horse Bigirononhiship failed to start. no run for my money I lost single and fc bet placed.

attributes.action: be able to self-exclude from book makers and casinos for more then a year
attributes.background: I know from experience and self banning use to be five years now it's only one year and that's not enough we should at least have a right to choose how long we can ban ourselves for.

attributes.action: 15 hrs free childcare payable to registered childminders  related to child.
attributes.background: My grandson may miss out on his 15 hrs free childcare because as an ofsted registered childminder & his grandma I wasn't allowed to provide his free 15 hrs . Both his parents & I think it's wrong that because I'm related I'm not allowed to provide the 15 hours he is ENTITLED TO BY LAW .

attributes.action: To make the A15 a dual carriageway road from the M18 to the A46 north of Lincoln
attributes.background: An undulating road with plenty of accident blackspots. New Junctions required at  Caenby Corner, Hibaldstow, and a new junction at the A15, A46 Lincoln end. Levelling off the road to eliminate blind spots especially in the night. A major road which is used by all classes of transport.
attributes.additional_details:
This improvement to the A15 is needed to stimulate trade for the area and will see economical efficiency increase. The access from the Humber Bridge, Grimsby and Scunthorpe will be greatly improved and the journey to work times decreased. This will also impact on traffic coming off the A1 onto A46 at Newark. 
The Department of Transport will confirm the high number of accidents on this stretch of road. It is also open to cyclists to use and is frequently used for time trials. This must cease.

attributes.action: Professionals completing babies checks, to screen mums for PND during 1st year
attributes.background: I am a mum of two children. I suffered PND with my second child. I had been to gp before birth but was told too close to birth to be given medication. I was then left and not checked. 14wks post birth I was in a really dark, scary place. Had it been checked during those 1st weeks id had gotten help

attributes.action: Reading Prison as an Enterprise Zone for new Businesses.
attributes.background: This petition proposes the multiuse development of Reading Prison. The Grade II-listed building would be used as a ‘Business Incubator’ where start-up companies share communal infrastructure but operate within a designated space themselves. The remaining site would be a residential development.
attributes.additional_details:
This site is perfect for new businesses, with access to the station as well as supporting industries in the surrounding area.
Existing centres of innovation (The University and Business parks) could be sources of collaboration.
Ernst and Young forecasts Reading to be the fastest growing local economy in the UK, making this a pivotal moment in Reading's economic future.
The prison site will enable a diverse range of new businesses to develop, further spreading Reading’s prosperity.

attributes.action: The Jury Should be Scrapped.
attributes.background: I feel that the jury should be scrapped due to the impact that the decision will have on the persons life. If the ECJ doesn't use a jury, why should other courts.

attributes.action: Make mansard and loft extensions permitted development in non-conservation areas
attributes.background: Mansard and loft extensions for terrace properties require planning permission.  This gives local authorities the power to refuse on design ground even when there is no objections from local residents.  These type of extensions should be automatically permitted except in conservation areas.

attributes.action: Make 16+ Zip Oyster cards a form of legal age identification for purchases.
attributes.background: Isn't it annoying going to the cinema and being turned away because you don't have any "accepted ID" on you? Trying to buy lottery tickets for your family? It isn't right that to be able to do these things, you have to carry your passport around, when there's a perfectly good ZIP card in your pocket

attributes.action: Do not ban fireworks to the public but increase the age of sale to 25 minimum.
attributes.background: Thousands of people respectively enjoy garden fireworks and use them accordingly, why should the whole nation have that taken away from them because of a few peoples irresponsible use of fireworks? It's not fair that everyone should pay because of a few.
attributes.additional_details: Fireworks have been used since the 12th century, animals and people have coped fine, animal owners have information widely available to them to help their animals cope. Lifting the age of sale to 25 will help stop the irresponsible use of fireworks. It is simply not fair to spoil it for everyone because of a few!

attributes.action: change the law on websites listing companies without the owners permission
attributes.background: Parliament needs to change the law on how websites list companies without the company owners permission. It should be up to the business owner to decide where and how their business is displayed and advertised, and be removed from any website at the owners request.

attributes.action: Introduce a mandatory, age appropriate theatre arts policy for KS2 year groups
attributes.background: Introduce a mandatory KS2 theatre arts policy that prevents schools from putting up annual plays that are age inappropriate with adult, sexist humour,that promote jaded stereotypes like flapper girls & have little or no educational merit.Is it fair, for only Y6 to perform on stage & not Y3,Y4 & Y5?
attributes.additional_details: I ask this because my daughter’s school believes that the annual school play is to showcase only Y6 children on stage, while it is perfectly justified for Y3, Y4 & Y5 children to be relegated below the stage, on chairs,getting up to sing collectively,for only 8-14 minutes in a 60-70 minutes long production, for 3 successive years, before they are allowed to perform on stage,largely in unsuitable,tasteless plays that validate outdated, objectionable attitudes and behaviours insidiously, in kids.

attributes.action: All telecoms personnel in the UK should be licensed
attributes.background: I have experienced poor service from a telecoms provider, which resulted in me being given 2.6-2.8 Mb when 10-15Mb was freely available at my home. People who work in the telecoms industry have a great deal of power, and should be licensed and checked before they can work.
attributes.additional_details: I have suffered over the years with a controlled censorship on my business lines resulting in call drop outs at an alarming rate,  yet when I called the 1471 service 99.9% of these callers were unavailable which I find very odd. Yet friends and family and established clients have no problems contacting me. The present system is out of date and Ofcom needs more power to regulate the industry. Security is a major problem - there are 2000 calls a day to Action Fraud.

attributes.action: All Referendums should be fought on the Parliamentary Election Register
attributes.background: I am petitioning Referendum should be fought on the Parliamentary Election Register not the Local Government register for all future referendums in the UK
